item.title: Subsampling channels for robust connectivity estimation
item.description: New series: Explaining papers [#1] Lately, we published a new paper on estimating functional connectivity from electrophysiological data (Westner, Kujala, Gross, & Schoffelen, 2024). Let me give you a short description of what we did! Estimating functional connectivity from electrophysiological (i.e., EEG or MEG) data means that one wants to see if any brain areas show activity that is somehow synchronised (although this synchronisation can be shifted in time: think of two people clapping together or clapping alternatingly - both is considered a synchronisation in the neuroscience world).

item.title: I have seen this before. Pattern completion in the human visual system and its role for memory
item.description: From 2020 to 2022, I was funded by a Marie Curie Individual Fellowship of the EU Horizon 2020 scheme. This allowed me to join the lab of Prof. Floris de Lange at the Donders Institute at the Radboud University in Nijmegen to research visual anticipation and its relation to memory. Unfortunately, this fellowship was overshadowed by the COVID-19 pandemic, so progress on the project was a little slower than anticipated.
